de.lambeck.pned.models.data

Interface IDataModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataModel

    public interface IDataModel
extends IModel
    Sub type of IModel for data models (with all persistent information loaded from or saved to PNML files).
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

    • Method Detail

      • getElements

        java.util.List<IDataElement> getElements()
        Returns a list with all IDataElement in this IDataModel.
        Returns:
        all IDataElement as Java List

      • setModified

        void setModified(boolean b,
                 boolean revalidate)
        Adds parameter "revalidate" to setModified(boolean b) in IModel because not all changes to the model change the structure of the workflow net. (e.g. renaming a node)

        Note: Use this method in the IDataModelController only because some changes in the data model (e.g. firing a transition) must leave the validation unchanged (because validators may reset the marking of the Petri net to the initial marking)!
        Parameters:
        b - The new state
        revalidate - Indicates whether the changes require a revalidation of the model.

      • getElementById

        IDataElement getElementById(java.lang.String id)
                     throws PNNoSuchElementException
        Returns the IDataElement with the specified id.
        Parameters:
        id - The id to search for
        Returns:
        The IDataElement if found
        Throws:
        PNNoSuchElementException - If this model has no element with the specified id

        Throws:

      • isModelChecked

        boolean isModelChecked()
        The check state indicates, whether the model needs checking or not. This function indicates the current state
        Returns:
        false = model needs checking, true = model already checked

      • isInitialModelCheck

        boolean isInitialModelCheck()
        This function indicates whether the next validation of this model is the initial validation after reading from a PNML file.

        Note: This function is necessary for the InitialMarkingValidator to allow to decide whether to reset the marking or not.
        Returns:
        true = model was never checked before, false = model already was checked before

      • setModelChecked

        void setModelChecked(boolean b,
                     boolean removeInitialCheckState)
        The check state indicates, whether the model needs checking or not. This method will set this state.

        The IDataModelController has to invoke this method whenever changes to this data model change the structure of the Petri net. (Not simple changes like moving or renaming nodes.)

        Note: Parameter "removeInitialCheckState" allows to control which validation counts as "initial validation" because "initial validation" is abort condition for some implementations of IValidator.

        Example: Used in InitialMarkingValidator to avoid resetting the initial marking when loading from a PNML file.
        Parameters:
        b - new model check state
        removeInitialCheckState - True = remove "initial check" state from the model, false = do not change the "initial check" state

      • isModelValid

        boolean isModelValid()
        The validity state indicates, whether the model is valid or not. This function indicates the current state. Any changes to the model will set this state to false.
        Returns:
        false = model is invalid / has errors, true = model is valid

      • setModelValidity

        void setModelValidity(boolean b)
        The validity state indicates, whether the model is valid or not. This method will set this state.
        Parameters:
        b - new model check state

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Checks whether this IDataModel is empty.
        Returns:
        true = this IDataModel is empty; false = not empty
